Search for Breakpoints within a Segment Using MAF Data

Source: R/AIsegmentation.R
SearchBreakpoint.Rd

Refines breakpoints within a segment using MAF data. If enough informative MAF sites are present, the segment may be split into finer regions based on MAF clustering and merging.

Usage

SearchBreakpoint(seg_row, baf, mergeai, snpmin, minaisize, aibinsize)

Arguments

seg_row

A data frame row (list or tibble row) representing a single segment. Must have columns: Sample, Chromosome, Start, End, Num_Probes, Segment_Mean, Segment_Mean_raw, Count, Baseline_cov, gatk_gender, pipeline_gender, size.

baf

A data frame or tibble containing MAF data. Must include columns: Chromosome, Start, End, baf.

mergeai

Numeric. Threshold for the difference in MAF (gmm_mean) between adjacent segments to allow merging.

snpmin

Numeric. Minimum SNP count required for a segment to be considered as a separate segment.

minaisize

Numeric, smallest AI segment size (default: 1000000).

aibinsize

Numeric, AI bin size (default: 500000).

Value

A data frame with the refined segment(s), including updated breakpoints, MAF metrics, and a BreakpointSource column indicating whether breakpoints were post-processed or from GATK.
